sense.gloss: (suffering) damage, injury, harm
defendant, the accused
cover, mantle, shroud, hood
being a victim of (some disaster), suffering from
indicates the target of an activity, -ee (e.g. employee, examinee, trustee)
being bombed
being A-bombed, being nuked, being exposed to radiation (from an atomic blast)
to cover, to hide, to conceal, to wrap, to disguise
subject (of a medical experiment, etc.), test subject, trial subject, testee
examinee (of a full-body scan, etc.)
to put on (one's head), to wear, to have on, to pull over (one's head), to crown (oneself)
to be covered with (dust, snow, etc.), to pour (water, etc.) on oneself, to dash on oneself, to ship water
to bear (e.g. someone's debts, faults, etc.), to take (blame), to assume (responsibility), to shoulder (burden)
to overlap (e.g. sound or color)
to be similar, to be redundant
to be fogged (due to overexposure, etc.)
to close, to come to an end
to get a full house, to sell out
to blunder, to bungle, to fail
to be deceived
to suffer, to receive (kindness, rebuke, support), to sustain (damage)

sdata.j: ↑近代↑↓きんだい↓↑的↑↓てき↓な↑港湾↑↓こうわん↓↑施設↑↓しせつ↓がないために、↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑船積↑↓ふなづ↓み↑業者↑↓ぎょうしゃ↓が↑不便↑↓ふべん↓を↑被↑↓こうむ↓った。
sdata.e: The lack of modern post facilities caused trouble for many shippers.

sdata.j: ↑教室↑↓きょうしつ↓では↑帽子↑↓ぼうし↓を↑被↑↓かぶ↓るべきではない。
sdata.e: Your hat should not be worn in the classroom.

sdata.j: ↑救助↑↓きゅうじょ↓↑隊員↑↓たいいん↓↑達↑↓たち↓が↑地震↑↓じしん↓の↑被災↑↓ひさい↓↑者↑↓しゃ↓↑達↑↓たち↓に↑物資↑↓ぶっし↓を↑分配↑↓ぶんぱい↓するだろう。
sdata.e: The rescue workers are going to hand out supplies to the victims of the earthquake.

sdata.j: ↑学校↑↓がっこう↓に↑行↑↓い↓くときは↑帽子↑↓ぼうし↓を↑被↑↓かぶ↓ります。
sdata.e: I put on a cap when I go to school.

sdata.j: ↑核↑↓かく↓↑戦争↑↓せんそう↓が↑起↑↓お↓きれば、↑全↑↓ぜん↓↑人類↑↓じんるい↓が↑被害↑↓ひがい↓を↑受↑↓う↓けるだろう。
sdata.e: All humanity will suffer if a nuclear war breaks out.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑水害↑↓すいがい↓の↑被害↑↓ひがい↓↑者↑↓しゃ↓に↑食物↑↓しょくもつ↓と↑衣類↑↓いるい↓を↑支給↑↓しきゅう↓した。
sdata.e: We provided the flood victims with food and clothing.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓たちは↑洪水↑↓こうずい↓の↑被災↑↓ひさい↓↑者↑↓しゃ↓に↑食↑↓た↓べ↑物↑↓もの↓と↑衣類↑↓いるい↓を↑提供↑↓ていきょう↓した。
sdata.e: We provided the flood victims with food and clothing.

sdata.j: ↑火↑↓ひ↓はすぐに↑消↑↓け↓されたので、その↑家↑↓いえ↓はあまり↑被害↑↓ひがい↓を↑受↑↓う↓けなかった。
sdata.e: The house did not suffer much damage because the fire was quickly put out.

sdata.j: ↑屋根↑↓やね↓は↑嵐↑↓あらし↓の↑被害↑↓ひがい↓を↑受↑↓う↓けました。
sdata.e: The roof was damaged by the storm.

sdata.j: ↑一方↑↓いっぽう↓で↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑大↑↓だい↓↑損害↑↓そんがい↓を↑被↑↓こうむ↓ったが、↑他方↑↓たほう↓その↑経験↑↓けいけん↓から↑学↑↓まな↓んだものも↑大↑↓おお↓きかった。
sdata.e: On the one hand we suffered a heavy loss, but on the other hand we learned a great deal from the experience.
